docs.snippet: The way David Ortiz’s first-person essay quickly went viral showed the growing reach of The Players’ Tribune, especially when an athlete has something provocative to say....
docs.lead_paragraph: The way David Ortiz’s first-person essay quickly went viral showed the growing reach of The Players’ Tribune, especially when an athlete has something provocative to say.
docs.abstract: Derek Jeter's first off-the-field venture, website known as The Players' Tribune, gives prominent athletes a direct pipeline to their fans, allowing them to express views on everything from drug testing to injury rehab and union grievances; Tribune's mission is to provide athletes with an opportunity to speak their minds without the middleman intervention of a journalist.

headline.main: Athletes Finding Their Voice in Derek Jeter’s Digital Venture
headline.print_headline: Athletes Find Their Voice in Jeter’s Digital Venture

byline.contributor: Tim Rohan and Billy Witz contributed reporting.

docs.snippet: The author John McPhee was at the Palestra in Philadelphia in March 1965 to chronicle the exploits of Princeton’s best player, Bill Bradley....
docs.lead_paragraph: The author John McPhee was at the Palestra in Philadelphia in March 1965 to chronicle the exploits of Princeton’s best player, Bill Bradley.
docs.abstract: Marc Tracy On College Basketball column examines history and importance of John McPhee book A Sense of Where You Are, 1965 biography of Bill Bradley; book was written when Bradley was a player for Princeton, the first Ivy League team to reach the NCAA Final Four.

headline.main: Portraying Bill Bradley, a Star Who Had a Sense of Where He Was
headline.print_headline: Portraying a Star Who Had a Sense of Where He Was

docs.snippet: A small but growing group of mostly men gather to drive fast and network with clients and others in the tech industry....
docs.lead_paragraph: A small but growing group of mostly men gather to drive fast and network with clients and others in the tech industry.
docs.abstract: Private racecar driving has emerged as an unlikely hobby and networking opportunity for Silicon Valley leaders; pastime nonetheless points up some flaws that industry is sensitive about, including its overwhelming preponderance of males, its association with outsize wealth, and its exclusivity and insularity.

headline.main: In Silicon Valley, Auto Racing Becomes a Favorite Hobby for Tech Elites

docs.snippet: For years, conditions inside the United States’ only federal supermax facility were largely a mystery. But a landmark lawsuit is finally revealing the harsh world within....
docs.lead_paragraph: For years, conditions inside the United States’ only federal supermax facility were largely a mystery. But a landmark lawsuit is finally revealing the harsh world within.
docs.abstract: Mark Binelli article describes how landmark lawsuit filed against Bureau of Prisons regarding conditions at United States Penitentiary Administrative Maximum Facility in Florence, Colo, revealed that prison was making its inmates go insane; notes that suit has also brought to fore the way use of solitary confinement in American prisons is exacerbating or creating prisoners' mental disorders.

headline.print_headline: ‘This Place Is Not Designed for Humanity’

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: United States Penitentiary Administrative Maximum Facility
